content.description: Start with your hands matched on the horizontal move out from the roof with an under cling, a jug, a crimp, and then a big move to the ledge. Heel hook it and pull up on some crimps.
content.protection: If you only have one pad you might want a spotter to move it around for you on this one.
content.location: This is the last boulder in the main area. Descend the boulders, walk right and you are there.

content.description: Do the first moves of Word is Bond and then keep right to many medium size crimps
content.location: Same start as Word is Bond

content.description: Classic roof climb with interesting moves and perfect rock. Start matched on the crimp in the center of the roof. Bust out right, paste your feet up high, and make physical bumps to a good crimp on the corner lip of the roof. Finish off with reachy moves to good edges on the center of the face.
content.location: Tailspin is easiest approached from above the cliff band. From the road walk until you hit the top and then head left until you see Tailspin below you. It is the only boulder in the band that faces eastward towards the road.

content.description: This is the climb to the right of the tree growing out of the rock. It is kind of tricky and crispy, but on great rock.
content.location: It's back there. Go get it.

content.description: Start to the left of the tree that is growing out of the boulder. There are some good moves to the big undercling and then some jugs. The top out is scary on this one. I hope you are ready to flop.
content.protection: A big pad and a great spotter.
content.location: Walk down the rocks and turn right. It's the biggest boulder back there and you will see the big roof. This climb is one the face to the left of the tree.

content.description: Start on the right hand arete with a side pull and mybe something else if you can fid it and then either gun it for the top or climb it static. Tricky floppy top out.
content.protection: Great landing, one pad and no spots.
content.location: When you enter the main area you will see the Tailspin boulder with the big roof, walk to the left and you will see a boulder stacked on another smaller boulder creating a little overhang about waist high. That is boulder area "A" in the guide.

content.description: Stand start with a crimp on the left and a weird side pull on the right. Head up and slightly left.
content.location: This is in the "A" section of the guide.

content.description: Climb the arete on the left of the "D" boulder in the guide.
content.protection: One big pad and a good spot.
content.location: Boulder "D" is found easily if you continue left on the herd path as you enter the boulder field. Jump down the boulders and bam you are looking a small rectangular boulder with exfoliating rock on one side and a somewhat slabby overhang on the other.

content.description: Start as Tree Line and climb up and right to finish via jugs to the left of Heather.

Starts on the far left of the Cave Boulder. Sds, hands on the large jug and feet on the block below. Work up through good holds to the large protruding block near the top. Make a large committing move to the block and top out to finish
content.location: When walking down to the cave it will be the first problem you come to if entering from the left.

content.description: This is an awesome area with great quality rock that sports climbs and projects for all levels. NOTE: There is an app available for iOS users  Pa Bouldering App There you will find the different boulders mapped out with beta.
